lead_paragraph: Young adults are grappling with what Britain’s vote to leave the European Union will mean for a way of life in which it’s normal to grow up in one country, study in another and work in a third.

headline.print_headline: For Europe’s Young, a Unifying Identity Is Shaken
headline.main: ‘Brexit’ Bats Aside Younger Generation’s European Identity

snippet: Young adults are grappling with what Britain’s vote to leave the European Union will mean for a way of life in which it’s normal to grow up in one country, study in another and work in a third....
abstract: Young Europeans say Britain's decision to leave European Union will change their globalized way of life; many young adults have taken for granted freedom to move throughout bloc, and now fear decision narrows their study, work, travel, residence and friendship options.
